text: The Parks Covered Bridge, in Perry County, Ohio near Chalfunts, Ohio, was built in 1883. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1974. It was built by William A. Dean and J.T. Tracey. It spans a branch of Jonathan Creek and is a "very good example" of a multiple kingpost truss covered bridge. It is located south of Chalfunts, and north of Somerset on County Road 33, in Hopewell Township, Perry County, Ohio. ==References== Category:Covered bridges in Ohio Category:National Register of Historic Places in Perry County, Ohio Category:Bridges completed in 1883
title: Parks Covered Bridge (Chalfunts, Ohio)
